content.text: Several updates and fixes have been made to the ElizaOS project, including bug fixes, dependency updates, and new features. Notable changes include the addition of a default voice for ElevenLabs, fixes for Discord tests, and updates to the Vitest dependency to address security vulnerabilities.

The ElizaOS project has also seen enhancements in its core functionalities, such as the consolidation of the RAG knowledge system, improvements in the plugin architecture, and the introduction of a new AI character. Additionally, there have been refactorings and documentation updates to improve code clarity and contributor guidance.

Bug fixes have been implemented to address issues such as vector dimension mismatches and prompt errors. These fixes ensure that the system's memory management and prompt handling are more robust and reliable.

The cryptocurrency market is experiencing a downturn with several major coins showing negative daily changes. Bitcoin, currently priced at $96,184, has a significant daily change of -1408.16, with a 24-hour trading volume of $16,060,355,250 and a market cap of $1,908,553,590,101.

categories.title: Issues with ElizaOS Discord Plugin and SDK Import

content.text: There is an error occurring in the ElizaOS Discord plugin when attempting to transcribe audio from a voice channel. The error message indicates a TypeError due to the SQLite database connection not being open. This issue arises during the voice message processing pipeline when accessing the database.

A bug has been identified in the advanced-sdk-ts import within the ElizaOS project. The import issue makes it impossible to correctly add @elizaos/agent to any new project due to its indirect dependency on @elizaos/plugin-coinbase, which relies on a specific local file. This problem prevents the expected behavior of importing @elizaos/agent correctly.

categories.title: Recent Updates and Challenges in the Tech Space

content.text: A user expressed frustration over a recent hack despite having strong security measures like 2FA and a password manager. The hack was described as well-designed and targeted, leading to a loss of funds for some.

Development efforts have been focused on fixing three bugs, with contributions from 13 individuals resulting in the merging of four pull requests. Major improvements were part of this development work.
A user is seeking ways to manipulate the X algorithm to regain access to a platform referred to as 'tpot'.
A partnership with @ai16zdao is being deepened, as highlighted in a recent update.
A user claims to have figured something out, sharing a link for more details.
